moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Advanced Theory and Practices/03 PR Shaping your Narrative/PR Basics: Who Are You

overview.quote: Your reputation is fundamentally the most important part of your career.
overview.introText: PR isn't just for celebrities. As your online presence grows, understanding how to shape your narrative becomes essential for building trust and maintaining a positive reputation in the digital space.

keyTerms.definition: Understanding yourself, who you're trying to be, and where you're trying to get to in the public eye.
The brief time (often just minutes per day) viewers have to form an opinion about you and your content.
A document outlining how you want to come across and what you stand for, serving as your content compass.
Clear lines you won't cross in your content, even when tempted by views or sponsorship deals.
The distinctive attitude and personality that comes through in your communication style.

actionPlan: Write down your core values and principles
Define your unique tone of voice

mainContent.title: The Viewer's Tiny Window
mainContent.text: Most people will only see you for minutes per day. The internet judges quickly and rarely cares about context, so make every second count in that small window of time.

summaryPoints: Nuanced opinions rarely fit in short content

mainContent.title: Think Beyond Today
mainContent.text: Don't just consider how your content lands today. Think about your future goals and how today's posts will be perceived as your audience and platform grow.

summaryPoints: Growth exposes content to wider scrutiny

mainContent.title: The Power of Questions
mainContent.text: Start with fundamental questions: Who are you? What do you care about most? What are you ultimately trying to achieve? What problems does your audience face?

summaryPoints: Your answers reveal your true north

mainContent.title: The Does & Doesn'ts Framework
mainContent.text: Create clear rules using simple language. 'I do support X' and 'I don't engage with Y' gives you instant decision-making power when opportunities arise.

summaryPoints: Write it down before temptation strikes
Update as you learn and grow

mainContent.title: Defending Your Boundaries
mainContent.text: When your audience grows, opportunities and money will test your principles. Having pre-established boundaries helps you make consistent decisions under pressure.

mainContent.title: Brand Evolution Planning
mainContent.text: Consider how your social media connects to your three-year vision. How will other platforms and mainstream media fit into your growth strategy as your reputation expands?

proTips.text: Write your PR principles when you're NOT in crisis. It's like creating a fire escape plan before there's smoke.
The 'pigeonhole test': If viewers had to describe you in three words, what would they be? Are those the right words?
Your most profitable brand deals will come from alignment with your values, not from taking whatever pays most.

finalWords.emphasis: Your reputation is built in drops but lost in buckets.
